article.headline: New Orleans 64, Lamar 62
article.story: LAMAR, Texas (AP) -- Bo McCalebb hit two free throws with 3.6 seconds left Wednesday night to give New Orleans a 64-62 victory over Lamar. Lamar's Brandon Chappell missed a contested 3-pointer at the buzzer. McCalebb scored 27 points and had 12 rebounds to lead New Orleans (2-4). James Parlow added 14 points for the Privateers. Darren Hopkins led Lamar (2-3) with 21 points. Matthew Barrow added 16. New Orleans led 41-34 at the half. Neither team had much success from the field in the second half, each hitting only six field goals. Barrow hit two free throws with 1:45 left in the game to tie the game at 62-62.
